intro: Byttneria eriogona, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain small, dark seeds. It is often found in forested areas and can grow up to several meters in height. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in horticulture.
